info.title: Soil Science in Your Hands
info.description:
<0>Discover the potential use and value of your land.</0> Accurately determine the soil type and other features of your land to gain insights for grazing and farming options, carbon sequestration, and more.

<2>There are three ways to use the map:</2>
info.list1: Tap the map to drop a pin and get more information about that location.
info.list2: Tap the location icon <icon /> to find your current location
info.list3: Enter coordinates, address, or search term in the search bar
info.description2: <0>Find more information and guides</0> in the side menu to the left or at <1>landpotential.org</1> <icon />.

empty.info:
You have not created any sites. Create a site with the button above or by finding the location on the map.

A site allows you to collect and save data, learn more about your land and its potential, and share with others.

<0>Learn more about using LandPKS</0> <icon />.

create.title: Create Site
create.coords_help: Enter decimal degrees, with latitude and longitude separated by a comma.
create.add_to_project_tooltip: The site will inherit the settings of the project, including data collection requirements and team members. Create new projects using the Projects tab in the bottom navigation.
create.privacy_tooltip: Public projects will sync data to public data portals.

form.name_min_length_error: Site name must be at least {{min}} characters
form.name_max_length_error: Site name must be at most {{max}} characters

coords_parse_error.COORDS_PARSE: Coordinates must be comma-separated decimal numbers representing a latitude, longitude pair
coords_parse_error.LATITUDE_PARSE: Latitude must be a decimal number
coords_parse_error.LONGITUDE_PARSE: Longitude must be a decimal number

delete_site_modal.body: This will permanently delete the site {{siteName}} and all of its data. This cannot be undone.

projects.label: Project

none.info: Projects let you group sites, set data needs, manage team members, and see audit logs.

projects.search_label: Enter text to filter projects by name

instructions.title: Pinned Note
instructions.description: This content will display at the top of the Notes section of each site in this project.

confirm_preset.title: Change depths?
confirm_preset.body: Soil pit data that has been entered will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.

leave_project_modal.title: Leave Project?
leave_project_modal.body: This will remove your access to the project, but data you have contributed will remain with the project.

settings.download_link_description: A zipped file of all the project’s assets including a .csv file of site data, field notes, audit logs, and photos. Anyone with this link can view all the assets.
settings.archive_description: The project will be moved to Archived Projects, making it read-only. Team members can access the data, and project managers can restore it at any time. Public projects that are archived will remain viewable on data portals.
settings.delete_description:
This will permanently delete the project’s data, as well as all of its sites and site data. This cannot be undone.

Alternatively, project managers can transfer the sites out of this project to retain their data.

sites.empty_viewer: This project has no sites yet.
sites.empty_contributor: You can transfer existing LandPKS sites to this project, or use the map on the Home screen to create new sites to add to this project.

delete_site_modal.title: Delete site?
delete_site_modal.body:
This will permanently delete the site {{siteName}} and all of its data. This cannot be undone.

Project managers can remove the site from this project to retain its data.

remove_site_modal.title: Remove site from project?
remove_site_modal.body: Only you will have access to this site and its data. Other project team members will no longer have access.

add_user.heading: Add Team Members
add_user.help_text: Enter single or multiple Terraso email addresses in the field below.
add_user.user_does_not_exist: User {{email}} is not a Terraso user, unable to add to project.
add_user.user_in_project: User {{email}} is already a member of this project.
add_user.already_added: User {{email}} already added to user list.

manage_member.manager_help: Can view and edit all aspects of the projects and its affiliated sites.
manage_member.contributor_help: Can view, add, and edit site data.
manage_member.remove_help: Remove the team member's access to this project, retaining any data contributed to sites
manage_member.confirm_removal_body: This will remove the team member from the project, but will retain their contributed site data.

transfer_sites.heading: Transfer existing sites
transfer_sites.description: Choose existing LandPKS sites you manage to transfer to this project. Note that only those who have access to the project will be able to access the sites in the project.
transfer_sites.tooltip: Sites you transfer to this project will inherit this project’s data settings, input requirements, and team members. Learn more...

form.name_max_length_error: Project name must be at most {{max}} characters
form.description_max_length_error: Project description must be at most {{max}} characters

search.no_matches: No projects match the current search and filter options.

info.privacy_item1: <0>The data visible in public sites</0> includes all data entered into the LandPKS mobile app except for personally identifiable information (PII).
info.privacy_item2: <0>Public sites</0> are visible to anyone on the LandPKS data portal. This means anyone can view information about this site.
info.privacy_item3: <0>Unaffiliated private sites</0> are only visible to you. You can change the privacy of the site at any time.
info.privacy_item4: <0>A project’s privacy setting determines the privacy of its affiliated sites.</0> Sites that belong to a private project are visible to project team members. A project manager can change the privacy at any time.
info.privacy_item5: <0>When a site is transferred to a project,</0> the project will determine the site’s privacy setting.
info.privacy_item6: Read more about our data privacy policy:

login.title: LandPKS
login.subtitle: Discover the potential of your land
login.description: LandPKS is a Terraso soil science tool.

vertical_cracking.description:
Vertical cracks may appear on the soil surface when some soils experience changes in moisture or temperature. The cracks may be permanent, or they may disappear after some time.

Vertical cracks are at least $t(soil.vertical_cracking.description_width, {"context": "{{units}}"}) wide and $t(soil.vertical_cracking.description_depth, {"context": "{{units}}"}) deep. You should be able to place a pencil inside the cracks.

soil_preset.info: Data already entered for a depth will be deleted when the depth interval is changed.
soil_preset.label: Depth Intervals

update_modal.title: Change depth?
update_modal.body: Data that has been entered at this depth will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.

guide.ribbon_help: Does the soil form a ribbon?

texture.guide_intro: Don’t know your soil texture? Use the step-by-step guide.

color.title: Soil Color

info.p1: Soil color can tell you a lot about soil, including:
info.bullet2: How much organic matter is present
info.p2: Soil color can be measured using a Munsell book or spectrometer.
info.p3: In this app, you can also take a photo with a reference card like a Post-It Note to determine your soil color.

step1.title: 1. Gather Post-It® Notes.
step1.content: To ensure accurate color analysis you must use 3M Canary Yellow Post-It® Notes for your reference card, with these guidelines:

bullets.2: Stack at least 3 Post-it Notes on top of each other.
bullets.3: Make sure each Post-It note lays flat, isn’t written on, and isn’t dirty.
bullets.4: Make sure each Post-It note isn’t degraded by sunlight, as considerable variation can exist depending on sun exposure.
bullets.5: Store Post-It notes in dark envelopes to avoid sun exposure.

step2.title: 2. Prepare Soil Sample.
step2.content:
Use dry soil whenever possible. The app does have a way to indicate if your soil is wet, but dry soil color estimates are more accurate.

If your soil layer has multiple colors (i.e. mottles, redoximorphic features, or carbonates), isolate the dominant matrix color from the pile.

Run soil through a 2mm sieve to create a pile of homogenous soil, or use your hands to pick out anything larger than 2mm or 1/16”.

Flatten the pile of soil to minimize shadows within the soil sample.

step3.title: 3. Prepare lighting.
step3.content:
The soil color photo needs to be taken in even lighting conditions and shaded from direct sun.

Try to have an overhead light source rather than side lighting.

step4.title: 4. Place reference card next to soil.
step4.content: Place the Post-It note next to the prepared soil sample, in the proper lighting conditions.

step5.title: 5. Ready to take the photo?
step5.content: If you’ve followed the instructions above, you’re ready! You can take a photo with your device’s camera, or go back to upload a photo.

color.crop_reference: Crop image to show only the 3M Canary Yellow Post-It® Note. Pinch the image with your thumb and forefinger to zoom in (pinching inward) or zoom out (pinching outward). Move the image in the box by swiping with one finger.
color.crop_soil: Crop image to show only the soil sample. Pinch the image with your thumb and forefinger to zoom in (pinching inward) or zoom out (pinching outward). Move the image in the box by swiping with one finger.
color.lighting_condition: Photo has even lighting and no shadows:
color.use_photo_instead: Don’t know the soil color values? Use a photo instead (guide included.)
color.photo_need_help: To use a photo to determine soil color, you’ll need a 3M Canary Yellow Post-it® Note for color reference and a properly prepared soil sample. Need help? Use the step-by-step guide.

steepness.description: Enter steepness manually, using the slope meter, or selecting from the images below.
steepness.confirm_body: Are you sure you want to override the slope data?
steepness.no_camera_explanation: For best results, allow LandPKS to use your camera in Settings
